Set the value as a number without "px". --> | background = group_or_band | alias = | origin = [[Telemark]], [[Norway]] | genre = [[Black metal]]<br>[[Dark ambient]] | years_active = 1991–2005 | label = Norse League Productions<br>Northern Heritage | associated_acts = [[Thou Shalt Suffer]]<br>[[Emperor (band)|Emperor]]<br>Sort Vokter | website = }} '''Ildjarn''' was a [[black metal]] project from [[Norway]] that formed in 1991. Ildjarn recorded music until 1997 but did not officially end until 2005. The man behind Ildjarn was Vidar Vaaer, although some releases were collaborations with a musician known as Nidhogg. Ildjarn's music was a very simple and [[low fidelity|lo-fi]] brand of black metal, with most songs composed of basic drum patterns, a couple of riffs, and unintelligible vocals. The band's style has been compared to [[hardcore punk]] in its simplistic ferocity and short song lengths. Two Ildjarn albums were made entirely on a synthesizer. Of all the released music, the only Ildjarn song to have its lyrics published was "Eksistensens Jeger", from the self-titled ''Ildjarn-Nidhogg'' compilation. In 2006, the band website stated that no more news would be printed, leading to the conclusion that Ildjarn had ended. The title of Ildjarn's 2005 release, ''Ildjarn is Dead'', further supports this conclusion. Part of Vidar Vaaer's motivation for ending Ildjarn was due to his 4-track recorder breaking (the same 4-track recorder used during [[Emperor (band)|Emperor's]] early days as [[Thou Shalt Suffer]]).<ref>http://www.anus.com/metal/about/interviews/ildjarn/</ref> The related band Sort Vokter consisted of Ildjarn, Nidhogg and two other members known as Tvigygre and Heiinghund.
